external_references.source_name: PaloAlto Unit42 ContagiousInterview BeaverTail InvisibileFerret October 2024
external_references.description: Unit42. (2024, October 9). Contagious Interview: DPRK Threat Actors Lure Tech Industry Job Seekers to Install New Variants of BeaverTail and InvisibleFerret Malware. Retrieved October 17, 2025.

objects.description: [BeaverTail](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1246) has masqueraded as MiroTalk installation packages: “MiroTalk.dmg” for macOS and “MiroTalk.msi” for Windows, and has included login GUIs with MiroTalk themes.(Citation: PaloAlto Unit42 ContagiousInterview BeaverTail InvisibileFerret October 2024)
